MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Double
MASH.NOTES: Used for some authentic German styles. Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Profiles vary. Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C. Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 5.00 gal of water at 126.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 1.61 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 0.98 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Single
MASH.NOTES: Used in some authentic German styles. Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Profiles vary. Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C. Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 5.00 gal of water at 126.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 2.12 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Triple
MASH.NOTES: Authentic Germany mash schedule. Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Some sources recommend that each decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Acid Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 5.00 gal of water at 97.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 1.33 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 1.67 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 0.90 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Triple, Lager
MASH.NOTES: Derived from Noonan, "New Brewing Lager Beer". A pure infusion/decoction mash with no temperature steps. The book recommends adding boiling water for the second step, though it appears it would come in too high in temperature. The first two decoctions are from the "heaviest" part of mash while the third is from the "thinnest". He also recommends you hold Dextrinization until it passes an iodine test (probably more than 20 minutes)

MASH_STEP.NAME: Dough-In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.25 gal of water at 70.0 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Acid Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 1.56 gal of water at 165.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 0.73 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Dextrinization Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 1.68 gal of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 1.21 gal of mash and boil it

MASH.NAME: Double Infusion, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: A full bodied mash profile for beers requiring a protein rest. Used for beer with large portions of unmodified adjuncts such as unmalted wheat.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.25 gal of water at 132.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccrification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.00 gal of water at 206.7 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 1.50 gal of water at 199.4 F

MASH.NAME: Double Infusion, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Double step infusion - for light body beers requiring a protein rest. Used primarily in beers high in unmodified grains or adjuncts.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.25 gal of water at 132.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccrification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.00 gal of water at 187.9 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.00 gal of water at 210.3 F

MASH.NAME: Double Infusion, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Double step infusion - for medium body beers requiring a protein rest. Used primarily in beers high in unmodified grains or adjuncts.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.25 gal of water at 132.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccrification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.00 gal of water at 197.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 1.75 gal of water at 205.6 F

MASH.NAME: Infusion Mash with Precooked Adjuncts
MASH.NOTES: Long protein rests help to break down starches in precooked adjuncts in preparation for saccharification step.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.00 gal of water at 111.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 0.75 gal of water at 180.9 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 1.75 gal of water at 201.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 2.25 gal of water at 207.6 F

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 170.5 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 1.25 gal of water at 196.6 F

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Full Body, Batch Sparge
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains (about 95% of the time).

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 170.5 F

MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 170.5 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 170.5 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 161.4 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 165.9 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts. Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 128.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 158.0 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts. Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 129.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 150.0 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts. Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.13 gal of water at 129.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 154.0 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min
